title: Goodyear faces a judicial storm
summary: 'The Goodyear affair' (4/4). In the early 2020s, new expert reports put the blame on certain Goodyear tires, which were responsible for numerous truck accidents. Then two whistle-blowers provided Le Monde with internal documents from the company, now under threat from the judiciary.

title: Who's behind the series of fake threats targeting French schools?
summary: Most of the false alarms that have recently disrupted several French schools appear to have been the result of malicious pranks, facilitated by the misuse of school messaging service accounts.

title: The reasons behind Paris' historical population decline
summary: The spectacular fall in the birth rate, the lack of housing and the growing number of separations are just some of the reasons behind the loss of 73,000 Parisians in six years.

title: French court sentences 'Tinder rapist' to 18 years in prison
summary: Salim Berrada, a 38-year-old photographer who lured women on dating apps, was found guilty of 12 rapes and three sexual assaults committed between 2014 and 2016.

title: Japan navigates diplomacy between the North and the Global South
summary: Thanks to its credibility with non-Western countries, Prime Minister Fumio Kishida's country is a major diplomatic player in the development of a new world order.

title: Six bodies of French soldiers to be repatriated 70 years after the battle of Dien Bien Phu
summary: Five of the bodies are anonymous and will be subjected to DNA tests in an attempt to identify them. This operation, carried out with Hanoi's approval, reflects a warming of diplomatic relations between Vietnam and France on the issue of remembrance.

title: 'I have no enemies, it's them that don't like me': Aya Nakamura brushes off haters in new single
summary: In her newly released song 'Doggy,' the most popular French-language singer in the world makes fun of those who lashed out against her rumored performance at the Paris Olympics.

title: War in Ukraine: Anxiety spreads over illegal enlistments in Odesa
summary: After two years of conflict, cases of illegal mobilization and military personnel's violence at recruitment centers have increasingly been made public.

title: Macron tells Senegalese president-elect France wants to 'intensify partnership'
summary: Emmanuel Macron offered Bassirou Diomaye Faye 'warm congratulations' for his election, the French presidency said.

title: 'Oppenheimer' premieres in Japan months after global release
summary: The US blockbuster, which was met with worldwide acclaim and won seven Oscars, was released on Friday in Japan, a nation where the subject of nuclear weapons is a highly sensitive and traumatic one.

title: Northern Ireland: Jeffrey Donaldson, leader of main unionist party, resigns
summary: The Democratic Unionist Party said its leader Jeffrey Donaldson had been charged with 'allegations of an historic nature.' British media reported they were offenses of a sexual nature.

title: WSJ marks one year of journalist's detention in Russia with blank front page
summary: The US government has declared that Evan Gershkovich, 32, is wrongfully detained, meaning it effectively regards him as a political hostage.

title: 'Marchand Madness' washes over NCAA swimming finals ahead of 2024 Olympics
summary: On Thursday night, Léon Marchand claimed his sixth university title by smashing the 500-yard freestyle record. His accomplishments have built his legend in the United States.

title: Gaza: International Court of Justice orders Israel to prevent starvation from 'setting in'
summary: The ICJ ordered Israel to guarantee the supply of food and water to the population of the Palestinian territory, which, according to the UN secretary general, is enduring 'appalling levels of hunger and suffering.'

title: Polish president vetoes bill restoring access to emergency contraception
summary: The bill to restore prescription-free access to the 'morning-after pill' came from Prime Minister Donald Tusk's government, more liberal than that of President Andrzej Duda's party, which restricted access to the pill in 2017.

title: Macron quips about cuddly 'wedding' pics with Lula
summary: The pictures of Macron's three-day visit to Brazil showed the French president and his Brazilian counterpart ambling through the Amazon and posing beneath the soaring canopy in white button-down shirts.

title: Louis Gossett Jr., first Black man to win supporting actor Oscar, dies at 87
summary: Gossett got his breakthrough on the show 'Roots,' for which he won an Emmy, and later for an Academy Award and a Golden Globe for 'An Officer and a Gentleman.'

title: FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried sentenced to 25 years in prison for embezzling customer money
summary: Prosecutors had asked for between 40 and 50 years' imprisonment for the 32-year-old American, whose cryptocurrency platform went bankrupt in 2022.

title: Transgender minors: How the debate on puberty blockers evolved in the UK
summary: The 2022 closure of the UK health system's only department dedicated to the health of transgender children has led to increased scrutiny over the use of these drugs for minors experiencing gender dysphoria.

title: Istanbul mayor election: The opposition and Erdogan's party are locked in a tight race
summary: In the country's richest megalopolis of 16 million inhabitants, the election pits the incumbent CHP mayor against the candidate of the ruling AKP party in a tense atmosphere.

title: What the science says about transgender minors and hormone therapy
summary: In a report, conservative French senators call for banning medical transitions before the age of majority. Their proposal runs counter to international recommendations based on an abundance of scientific literature.

title: Togo's parliament to review controversial constitutional reform
summary: Parliament on Monday passed a law granting the assembly the authority to elect the president for a single six-year term but President Faure Gnassingbe sent the text back for 'a second reading.'

title: Transgender minors: Families and health workers concerned about French senators' threats to care
summary: A report by conservative French senators calls for a ban on hormone therapy and puberty blockers. But professionals who have experience working with trans teenagers say the recommendations are a world away from the experiences of trans teenagers.

title: Ireland: 'The voters' double no vote should be interpreted as a protest vote against the government'
summary: On March 8, Irish voters rejected two constitutional amendments on the family and carers. University College Dublin law professor Marie-Luce Paris cites government overconfidence as the cause in an op-ed for Le Monde.

title: Israel wants to 'expand' its campaign against Hezbollah
summary: Israeli strikes killed dozens of Syrian soldiers on Friday. Lebanon fears an escalation of the conflict.

title: Polish PM Tusk warns Europe has entered 'pre-war era'
summary: A war on Europe is 'no longer a concept from the past,' Donald Tusk said on Friday.

title: Egypt gets a bailout after reaching deal with IMF
summary: The International Monetary Fund approved an $820 million bailout for the country's ailing economy.

title: Wembanyama's big night trumps Brunson's 61 points in Spurs win over Knicks
summary: The French basketball star scored 40 points on Friday in his San Antonio Spurs team's victory over the New York Knicks.

title: Orca's death in Europe's biggest marine park raises questions over animal welfare
summary: Inouk the orca's death is the second in less than six months at Marineland in southern France. A ban on orca shows is set for 2026.

title: Iranian TV journalist stabbed in London in stable condition
summary: London's Metropolitan Police has said its counter-terrorism unit is investigating the stabbing of Pouria Zeraati, given previous hostile threats by Iran against perceived opponents in Britain.

title: Poland, Czech Republic warn of Russian interference ahead of European elections
summary: A Moscow-backed network, 'Voice of Europe', was busted by Prague earlier this week. The site reportedly paid MEPs to spread pro-Russian propaganda.

title: Russia moves 5,000 children from Belgorod after Kyiv attacks
summary: The region has been repeatedly targeted by attacks from Ukraine since Russia's invasion in 2022.
